bill.title: Affirming Hawaii's Ongoing Commitment To The Goals Of The Paris Climate Agreement And United Nations Sustainable Development Goals And Endorsement Of The Fossil Fuel Non-proliferation Treaty.
bill.description: Affirming Hawaii's Ongoing Commitment To The Goals Of The Paris Climate Agreement And United Nations Sustainable Development Goals And Endorsement Of The Fossil Fuel Non-proliferation Treaty.

history.action: Offered.
Referred to GVO/AEN.
The committee(s) on GVO/AEN has scheduled a public hearing on 03-29-22 3:00PM; Conference Room 016 & Videoconference.

The committee(s) on GVO recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in GVO were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Moriwaki, Chang, Gabbard; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Dela Cruz, Fevella.

The committee(s) on AEN recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in AEN were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Gabbard, Nishihara, Acasio, Rhoads; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Fevella.
Reported from GVO/AEN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3800) with recommendation of adoption, as amended (SD 1).
One Day Notice 04-07-22.
Report and Resolution Adopted, as amended (SD 1). Transmitted to House.
Received from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 683) in amended form (SD 1).
Referred to EEP, JHA, referral sheet 47
Resolution scheduled to be heard by EEP on Thursday, 04-14-22 9:00AM in conference room 325 Via Videoconference.

The committees on EEP recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 6 Ayes: Representative(s) Lowen, Marten, Hashem, Matayoshi, Perruso, Matsumoto; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Todd, Tokioka.
Reported from EEP (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2055-22) as amended in HD 1, recommending referral to JHA.

Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on JHA as amended in HD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) McDermott voting no (1) and Representative(s) Ohno, Woodson excused (2).
Resolution scheduled to be heard by JHA on Thursday, 04-21-22 1:30PM in conference room 325 Via Videoconference.

The committees on JHA recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 8 Ayes: Representative(s) Nakashima, Matayoshi, Ichiyama, LoPresti, Lowen, Nakamura, Takumi, Tokioka; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 3 Excused: Representative(s) D. Kobayashi, McKelvey, Ward.
Reported from JHA (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2148-22), recommending adoption.
Adopted with Representative(s) Ward voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Kong, McDermott, Okimoto voting no (3) and Representative(s) Quinlan excused (1).
Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 786).
Senate disagrees with House amendments.
Received notice of disagreement (Sen. Com. No. 916).
Reconsideration of action taken on 04-26-22 in disagreeing to the House amendments.
Senate agrees with House amendments. Placed on the calendar for Final Adoption on 05-05-22.
One Day Notice 05-05-22.
Received notice of reconsideration (Sen. Com. No. 956).
Received notice of Senate agreement and Adoption (Sen. Com No. 956).
Resolution adopted in final form.
Certified copies of resolutions sent, 06/06/22.

votes.desc: Senate Government Operations: Passed, With Amendments
Senate Agriculture and Environment: Passed, With Amendments
House Energy & Environmental Protection: Passed, With Amendments
House Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs: Passed, Unamended
